metadata.title: USN-6279-1 -- OpenSSH update
metadata.description: It was discovered that OpenSSH has an observable discrepancy leading to an information leak in the algorithm negotiation. This update mitigates the issue by tweaking the client hostkey preference ordering algorithm to prefer the default ordering if the user has a key that matches the best-preference default algorithm.  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-6279-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  openssh-client - 1:6.6p1-2ubuntu2.13+esm2 openssh-server - 1:6.6p1-2ubuntu2.13+esm2 ssh-askpass-gnome - 1:6.6p1-2ubuntu2.13+esm2 ssh - 1:6.6p1-2ubuntu2.13+esm2 ssh-krb5 - 1:6.6p1-2ubuntu2.13+esm2 openssh-sftp-server - 1:6.6p1-2ubuntu2.13+esm2 Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro
